wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup: 11/14/2014
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top articles from around the industry so that you can stay up-to-date on the state of employee engagement in CSR and sustainability on the go.

Peer Influence, Shaming Drives Green Behavior

You see someone else going green, and you think, I could do that. Although WeSpire is not in the market of shaming others, this article presents hard data to show how a few individuals’ behavior directly influences the behavior of their peers when it comes to going green. You can call this the network effect.

Consumer Technology and the Workforce of Tomorrow

Consumer technology such as smart phones, tablets, and even wearable technology is the future of engaging employees. Tracking, communicating, and analyzing the behavior (and in some cases the vitals) of your employee base is becoming recognized as an integral part of driving a successful work force.

The Business Risks of Water Shortages

Businesses across all industries are being affected by the drought, and investors want to know what they are doing about it. According to CDP, the number of investors calling for corporate accountability regarding water-related information has increased 300 percent since 2010. Last year, in response to the drought, WeSpire developed a project that has saved nearly 8 million gallons of water across our corporate clients. What is your company doing to fight the drought?

Supercharge Your CSR Commitments Through Employee Engagement

If you want a short and sweet checklist on what it will take to get a successful Employee Engagement in Corporate Social Responsibility initiative up and running, check out this article. It’s brief, but full of valuable info that can be applied beyond CSR to other initiatives your employee base cares about, such as sustainability.

Xerox Provides New Tools to Reduce Printing Impact

We love to see companies using persuasive technology to influence employee behavior because we know it works! Xerox is now offering a technology that tracks people’s paper use and challenges them to reduce their impact. This says a lot about the innovation at this company when you consider that once upon a time their primary source of revenue was based on how many pages people printed.
